result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaac A. Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid $25.00 per month commencing 09/01/2022 and each month thereafter or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaac A. Howard

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

11:27 AM; Case called for Pretrial conference.  Defendant Isaac A. Howard in court with attorney Cassandra A Miller.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Miller advises her client is prepared to proceed to plea and sentencing today.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Miller confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2.  Court orders Count 1 dismissed and read in.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Miller.

COUNT 2:
The Court Orders the Following:

3 Days Jail (Credit - 3 days) **TIME SERVED**

COSTS: $243.00;
	
DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 09/01/2022.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Cassie Miller has been appointed to represent the defendant.
Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

01:30 PM Defendant Isaac A. Howard in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
